subject: Sexual Health
title: STIs and Maternal Health
description: Learn STIs and Maternal Health in one minute.

hook.text: A mother's untreated STI can pass to her baby during pregnancy or birth with devastating effects.

buildup.text: Syphilis during pregnancy can cause stillbirth, birth defects, or neonatal death if not treated.

discovery.text: HIV can transfer from mother to child during delivery or breastfeeding without proper intervention.

twist.text: Simple prenatal screening and treatment can prevent nearly all mother-to-child STI transmission.

climax.text: Countries that mandate prenatal STI testing have virtually eliminated congenital syphilis and neonatal HIV.

punchline.text: Prenatal testing protects two lives at once.

quiz.question: How can mother-to-child STI transmission be prevented?
